content.description: This route is an easy, slabby, and fun line with pockets and an incredible climb view from the top. Seventy feet of bolted fun!
content.location: Left of the two routes. Rap back down from the chains--if you have to walk off, go climber's right and be prepared to walk for a while. The way down to the climber's left is a mess, with lower 5th class down-climbing on loose, cruddy rock, and should be avoided.

climbs.name: The Ant Route
climbs.fa: Ron Brunckhorst, Craig Zaspel, Van Alke - June 2001

content.description: This climb trends right across the face with some fun moves throughout and some early, questionable rock. Still worth the time, The Ant Route is accurately graded and will build character. Finish down and right of a large dead tree.
content.location: Right of its neighbor, this is currently the one of two lines. Rap or get lowered with a 50-60m rope.
